intro: Carum involucratum, commonly known as the woolly caraway, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and small white or yellowish flowers that bloom in umbels. Its seeds are often used in traditional medicine for their carminative and digestive properties. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments.
